metadata.title: Hermetic Virtues
metadata.description: Virtues specifically related to Hermetic magic and the Order of Hermes

virtues.name: Affinity with Art
virtues.description: You have a natural talent for one of the fifteen Hermetic Arts. Choose one Art when you take this Virtue.
virtues.effects: You gain experience points in the chosen Art as if you were studying from a book with a Quality equal to 5 + the Art's current score whenever you study that Art from any source.
virtues.notes: This is one of the most powerful Hermetic Virtues for character advancement

virtues.name: Apt Student
virtues.description: You learn quickly from books and teachers in laboratory and academic settings.
virtues.effects: Add +3 to rolls for studying from books and +3 to Lab Totals when learning spells from lab texts.
virtues.notes: Excellent for characters focused on magical research

virtues.name: Book Learner
virtues.description: You are exceptionally good at learning from books.
virtues.effects: Add +3 to Study Totals when learning from books. This does not apply to Lab Totals.
virtues.notes: Different from Apt Student - only affects book learning, not lab work

virtues.name: Cautious Sorcerer
virtues.description: You are careful and methodical in your magical practice.
virtues.effects: Add +3 to Lab Totals only if you spend at least one season doing nothing but lab work that season.
virtues.notes: Rewards focused, dedicated laboratory work

virtues.name: Cyclic Magic (positive)
virtues.description: Your magic is tied to natural cycles and is stronger at certain times.
virtues.effects: Choose a cycle (time of day, season, lunar phase, etc.). Your magic is +3 to casting totals during the beneficial part of the cycle, -3 during the opposed part.
virtues.notes: Net positive if you can time your magic appropriately

virtues.name: Diedne Magic
virtues.description: You have learned the lost secrets of spontaneous magic from House Diedne.
virtues.effects: Double the lowest applicable Art when calculating Spontaneous magic totals. This does not require expending Fatigue levels.
virtues.requirements: Extremely rare - requires special story circumstances
virtues.notes: Forbidden knowledge that could result in being declared Marched

virtues.name: Elementalist
virtues.description: You specialize in magic of a single element, gaining bonuses but suffering penalties with opposing elements.
virtues.effects: Choose Air/Ignem, Earth/Terram, Fire/Ignem, or Water/Aquam. +3 to all totals with chosen element, -3 with opposing element.
virtues.notes: Significant specialization that shapes entire magical career

virtues.name: Enduring Magic
virtues.description: Your spells last longer than normal.
virtues.effects: Add +2 magnitudes to the duration of all spells you cast for determining how long they last, but not for any other purpose.
virtues.notes: Very useful for utility and ongoing effect spells

virtues.name: Fast Caster
virtues.description: You can cast spells more quickly than normal.
virtues.effects: Add +3 to Initiative when casting spells. In addition, subtract 3 from the speed of ritual spells.
virtues.notes: Excellent for combat magi and emergency situations

virtues.name: Flexible Formulaic Magic
virtues.description: You can modify your formulaic spells slightly when casting them.
virtues.effects: You may change one parameter (Range, Duration, or Target) of a formulaic spell by one step when casting it, but the spell level is calculated using the higher parameter.
virtues.notes: Adds useful versatility to known spells

virtues.name: Flawless Magic
virtues.description: Your magic does not botch due to stress.
virtues.effects: You never roll botch dice when casting spells, even in stressful situations.
virtues.notes: Eliminates the risk of catastrophic magical failures

virtues.name: Free Study
virtues.description: You can continue learning without requiring increasingly advanced books.
virtues.effects: When studying Arts from books, treat all books as if they had a Level equal to your current score in the Art, if that would be higher than the book's actual Level.
virtues.notes: Removes the normal limitation of book levels

virtues.name: Gentle Gift
virtues.description: Your Gift does not cause the normal negative reaction in people and animals.
virtues.effects: People and animals do not react negatively to your presence due to the Gift. You do not suffer the -3 penalty to social interactions.
virtues.notes: Invaluable for any magus who interacts with mundanes

virtues.name: Good Teacher
virtues.description: You are skilled at teaching others magic and mundane subjects.
virtues.effects: Add +3 to Communication + Teaching when teaching. Students being taught by you gain +3 experience points.
virtues.notes: Excellent for covenant life and training apprentices

virtues.name: Great Intelligence
virtues.description: Your Intelligence is exceptionally high.
virtues.effects: Your Intelligence is +3 higher than your normal maximum (typically raising the limit from +3 to +6).
virtues.notes: Dramatically improves learning and lab work

virtues.name: Great Perception
virtues.description: Your Perception is exceptionally keen.
virtues.effects: Your Perception is +3 higher than your normal maximum (typically raising the limit from +3 to +6).
virtues.notes: Improves awareness and some magical activities

virtues.name: Harnessed Magic
virtues.description: You can control your magic even when you don't want to cast spells.
virtues.effects: You can choose not to use magic even when it would normally be automatic, such as when using magical items or being affected by spells.
virtues.notes: Allows selective use of magical effects

virtues.name: Hermetic Prestige
virtues.description: You have a reputation for excellence within the Order of Hermes.
virtues.effects: You have a Reputation (choose focus) of 3 within the Order. This provides +3 to social interactions with other Hermetic magi in appropriate situations.
virtues.requirements: Must choose specific area of prestige
virtues.notes: Very useful for political situations within the Order

virtues.name: Inventive Genius
virtues.description: You have a natural talent for creating new spells and magical innovations.
virtues.effects: Add +3 to Lab Totals when inventing spells. Add +6 to Lab Totals when creating original spells (not learning from lab texts).
virtues.notes: Essential for characters focused on magical research

virtues.name: Life-Linked Spontaneous Magic
virtues.description: You can sacrifice health for more powerful spontaneous magic.
virtues.effects: You may take Body levels as if they were Fatigue levels to power spontaneous magic. Each Body level taken gives the same benefit as a Fatigue level.
virtues.notes: Dangerous but potentially very powerful

virtues.name: Magical Memory
virtues.description: You have perfect recall for magical knowledge and experiences.
virtues.effects: You perfectly remember all magical knowledge, spells seen cast, and magical experiences. +3 to rolls involving magical memory.
virtues.notes: Useful for learning spells and magical investigation

virtues.name: Major Magical Focus
virtues.description: You have an exceptional talent with a specific type of magic.
virtues.effects: Choose a focus (e.g., 'fire magic', 'healing', 'animals'). Double all applicable Arts when calculating totals for magic within your focus.
incompatible_with: Minor Magical Focus with same focus
virtues.notes: Extremely powerful for specialized magic

virtues.name: Mastered Spells
virtues.description: You begin play with thoroughly mastered versions of some of your spells.
virtues.effects: Choose spells totaling 30 levels. You know these spells with a Mastery Score of 1 and one Mastery ability for each.
virtues.notes: Provides immediate access to spell mastery abilities

virtues.name: Method Caster
virtues.description: You have developed a specific method of casting that aids your magic.
virtues.effects: Choose a method (gestures, words, focus item, etc.). When you use this method, add +3 to Spell casting totals. Without it, suffer -6.
virtues.notes: High risk, high reward casting style

virtues.name: Minor Magical Focus
virtues.description: You have a talent with a specific type of magic.
virtues.effects: Choose a focus (e.g., 'fire magic', 'healing', 'animals'). Add the lowest applicable Art again when calculating totals for magic within your focus.
incompatible_with: Major Magical Focus with same focus
virtues.notes: Good specialization without major limitations

virtues.name: Personal Vis Source
virtues.description: You have access to a reliable source of vis that produces a small amount each year.
virtues.effects: You have a source that produces 3 pawns of vis per year of a single Art. The source is tied to you personally.
virtues.requirements: Must define the source and type of vis
virtues.notes: Valuable for laboratory work and magical research

virtues.name: Puissant Art
virtues.description: You have exceptional skill with one of the Hermetic Arts.
virtues.effects: Add +3 to the score of one Art for all purposes except experience point costs.
virtues.notes: One of the most popular Hermetic Virtues

virtues.name: Quiet Magic
virtues.description: You can cast spells without speaking loudly.
virtues.effects: You can cast spells while speaking quietly (whisper) without penalty. Normal voice gives +1 bonus instead of 0.
virtues.notes: Excellent for stealth and social situations

virtues.name: Secondary Insight
virtues.description: You can study two Arts simultaneously in the laboratory.
virtues.effects: When studying Arts in the laboratory, you may study a second Art at the same time, gaining half the normal experience in the second Art.
virtues.notes: Improves efficiency of laboratory study time

virtues.name: Side Effect
virtues.description: Your spells have a minor additional effect beyond their intended purpose.
virtues.effects: Choose a minor side effect that accompanies all your spells (flowers bloom, temperature drops, etc.). This effect is cosmetic but noticeable.
virtues.notes: Adds flavor but may make magic less subtle

virtues.name: Skilled Parens
virtues.description: Your parens was exceptionally skilled at teaching.
virtues.effects: You begin with 50 additional experience points that must be spent on Hermetic Arts and abilities taught during apprenticeship.
virtues.requirements: Must be spent on appropriate abilities
virtues.notes: Excellent for beginning characters

virtues.name: Special Circumstances
virtues.description: Your magic works better under specific circumstances.
virtues.effects: Choose specific circumstances (underground, at night, during storms, etc.). Add +3 to all casting totals when circumstances are met.
virtues.notes: Situational but potentially very powerful

virtues.name: Spell Improvisation
virtues.description: You can vary your formulaic spells more than normal.
virtues.effects: You may add or remove one magnitude worth of effect to formulaic spells when casting, but must make a stress roll with a botch threshold equal to the magnitude adjustment.
virtues.notes: Adds flexibility but with risk

virtues.name: Strong Faerie Blood
virtues.description: You have significant faerie ancestry that affects your magic.
virtues.effects: You are strongly connected to the Faerie realm. +3 to all totals when dealing with faeries and faerie magic. May learn some faerie powers.
virtues.notes: Provides access to unique magical abilities

virtues.name: Study Bonus
virtues.description: You learn faster when studying certain subjects.
virtues.effects: Choose one Art or Ability. Add +2 to Study Totals when learning that subject from any source.
virtues.notes: Good for focused character concepts

virtues.name: Subtle Magic
virtues.description: Your magic is less obvious and detectable.
virtues.effects: Add +3 to rolls to make your magic subtle or undetectable. Observers suffer -3 to notice your magic being cast.
virtues.notes: Excellent for covert operations

virtues.name: Temporal Influence
virtues.description: You can slightly influence the flow of time around yourself.
virtues.effects: Once per day, you may act as if you had +3 to Initiative for one round, or extend the duration of one spell by one step without changing its level.
virtues.notes: Rare and powerful time-related ability

virtues.name: Tethered Magic
virtues.description: Your spells maintain a connection to you that you can sense and influence.
virtues.effects: You can sense the status of spells you have cast and can choose to end them at any time, regardless of distance.
virtues.notes: Useful for ongoing spell management

virtues.name: Unbound Tongue
virtues.description: You can cast spells in any language you know.
virtues.effects: You may cast formulaic spells in any language you speak at score 4+, not just the language you learned them in.
virtues.requirements: Must know other languages at 4+ score
virtues.notes: Useful for international magi

virtues.name: Versatile Sleeper
virtues.description: You can maintain magical effects while sleeping.
virtues.effects: Concentration duration spells do not end when you fall asleep. You maintain normal Concentration with no penalty while sleeping.
virtues.notes: Allows overnight magical effects

virtues.name: Vim Mastery
virtues.description: You have exceptional understanding of raw magical power.
virtues.effects: Add +2 to all totals involving vis use, magical item activation, and penetration calculations.
virtues.notes: Broad benefits for magical activities

virtues.name: Wizard's Communion
virtues.description: You are skilled at participating in group magic.
virtues.effects: Add +3 to your effective Magic Theory score when participating in Wizard's Communion spells or other group magical activities.
virtues.notes: Essential for covenant-level magical projects
